org.apache.beam.sdk.util.state

Class StateTags

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.beam.sdk.util.state.StateTags

  • @Experimental(value=STATE)
public class StateTags
extends Object
    Static utility methods for creating StateTag instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> StateTag<Object,BagState<T>> bag(String id, Coder<T> elemCoder)
      Create a state tag that is optimized for adding values frequently, and occasionally retrieving all the values that have been added.
      static <InputT,AccumT,OutputT>

      Create a state tag for values that use a Combine.CombineFn to automatically merge multiple InputTs into a single OutputT.

      Convert an arbitrary StateTag to a system-internal tag that is guaranteed not to collide with any user tags.

                                                       Coder<T> valueCoder)
        Create a simple state tag for values of type T.

      • combiningValue

        public static <InputT,AccumT,OutputT> StateTag<Object,AccumulatorCombiningState<InputT,AccumT,OutputT>> combiningValue(String id,
                                                                                                                       Coder<AccumT> accumCoder,
                                                                                                                       Combine.CombineFn<InputT,AccumT,OutputT> combineFn)
        Create a state tag for values that use a Combine.CombineFn to automatically merge multiple InputTs into a single OutputT.

      • keyedCombiningValue

        public static <K,InputT,AccumT,OutputT> StateTag<K,AccumulatorCombiningState<InputT,AccumT,OutputT>> keyedCombiningValue(String id,
                                                                                                                         Coder<AccumT> accumCoder,
                                                                                                                         Combine.KeyedCombineFn<K,InputT,AccumT,OutputT> combineFn)
        Create a state tag for values that use a Combine.KeyedCombineFn to automatically merge multiple InputTs into a single OutputT. The key provided to the Combine.KeyedCombineFn comes from the keyed StateAccessor.

      • keyedCombiningValueWithContext

        public static <K,InputT,AccumT,OutputT> StateTag<K,AccumulatorCombiningState<InputT,AccumT,OutputT>> keyedCombiningValueWithContext(String id,
                                                                                                                                    Coder<AccumT> accumCoder,
                                                                                                                                    CombineWithContext.KeyedCombineFnWithContext<K,InputT,AccumT,OutputT> combineFn)
        Create a state tag for values that use a CombineWithContext.KeyedCombineFnWithContext to automatically merge multiple InputTs into a single OutputT. The key provided to the Combine.KeyedCombineFn comes from the keyed StateAccessor, the context provided comes from the StateContext.

      • combiningValueFromInputInternal

        public static <InputT,AccumT,OutputT> StateTag<Object,AccumulatorCombiningState<InputT,AccumT,OutputT>> combiningValueFromInputInternal(String id,
                                                                                                                                        Coder<InputT> inputCoder,
                                                                                                                                        Combine.CombineFn<InputT,AccumT,OutputT> combineFn)
        Create a state tag for values that use a Combine.CombineFn to automatically merge multiple InputTs into a single OutputT.

        This determines the Coder<AccumT> from the given Coder<InputT>, and should only be used to initialize static values.

      • bag

        public static <T> StateTag<Object,BagState<T>> bag(String id,
                                                   Coder<T> elemCoder)
        Create a state tag that is optimized for adding values frequently, and occasionally retrieving all the values that have been added.

      • watermarkStateInternal

        public static <W extends BoundedWindow> StateTag<Object,WatermarkHoldState<W>> watermarkStateInternal(String id,
                                                                                                      OutputTimeFn<? super W> outputTimeFn)
        Create a state tag for holding the watermark.

      • makeSystemTagInternal

        public static <K,StateT extends State> StateTag<K,StateT> makeSystemTagInternal(StateTag<K,StateT> tag)
        Convert an arbitrary StateTag to a system-internal tag that is guaranteed not to collide with any user tags.

      • convertToBagTagInternal

        public static <K,InputT,AccumT,OutputT> StateTag<Object,BagState<AccumT>> convertToBagTagInternal(StateTag<? super K,AccumulatorCombiningState<InputT,AccumT,OutputT>> combiningTag)
